entry.title: Multiple employments in Workzone, how do you handle user multiple employment user data?
entry.content:
Within SuccessFactors you can have multiple employments at the same time, this is typically for global assignment / international mobility use cases. This means both records are active at the same time, the user has one email address, etc. They are for our purposes the same user in WorkZone. 

WorkZone only has 1 profile for each user and then has an employment switcher in the top right when you have multiple employments, this essentially switches the active 'userId' when interacting with UI cards.

However, how do people handle access to workspaces based on employment data? Keeping the example simple is as follows:

Regardless of execution of the records, only one of them will fill in the country field. So, the answer I thought was simply using custom attributes! Do a check based on primary assignment, fill the address for Country A and custom attribute for Country B. However, WorkZone does not support PATCH requests so will delete data if not filled in.

So, how do others do it? How do you take employee data from 2 records and merge them into WorkZone using IPS? I can imagine how to do it using other tools, because you would GET all the existing data and just pass in the additional data. OR obviously PATCH requests would be excellent if supported and make this a non issue, but sadly they are not. 

What are others doing in this instace? Handling workspace assignments using something other than dynamic user lists? We've also used SF Permission Groups synced into WZ, however we hit a technical limit of groups (~100) so need to ideally use dynamic user lists/ something automatic not based on permission groups.

entry.title: email not received in post user creation SCIM cloud identity services
entry.content:
I am currently working with SAP Cloud Identity Services (IAS), automating user creation through the SCIM API. My goal is to have users receive the standard activation (welcome) email as soon as they are created and activated via the API, just as they do when activated manually through the IAS web interface.

Steps taken:

  1. POST /scim/Users
    I create the user with the following call:
JSON
 
{
  "schemas": ["urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:core:2.0:User"],
  "userName": "Dave.test",
  "name": {
    "familyName": "Dave",
    "givenName": "Dave"
  },
  "emails": [
    {
      "value": "dave.test@gmail.com",
      "primary": true
    }
  ],
  "active": false
}
  1. PATCH /scim/Users/{id}
    I then activate the user with this PATCH request:
JSON
 
{
  "schemas": ["urn:ietf:params:scim:api:messages:2.0:PatchOp"],
  "Operations": [
    {
      "op": "Replace",
      "path": "active",
      "value": true
    }
  ]
}
  1. User status verification:
    After the PATCH, the user status is "active": true both via API and in the IAS interface.

Observed behavior:

  • When I activate the user through the IAS interface, the activation/welcome email is sent immediately.
  • When I activate the user via SCIM API, the user is marked as active, but the activation email is not sent.
  • The email template is active and works (tested via UI), the email infrastructure (SMTP) is correct, and the emails do not end up in spam.
  • I do not have access to a Monitoring/Email Delivery section in IAS to check if the email was attempted.

How can i fix?

Thanks

Example:

All users assinged to group "BTP ABAP Environment Admins" (with technical ID "abap_admins") in IAS should be assigned to business role "Administrator" (with technical ID "SAP_BR_ADMINISTRATOR")

The basic transformation of the target BTP ABAP environment system in IPS is as follows:

	"user": {
		"condition": "isValidEmail($.emails[0].value) && (('%a4c.roles.prefix%' === 'null') || ($.groups[?(@.display =~ /%a4c.roles.prefix%.*/)] empty false))",

entry.title: User ID for IAS users
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

We provision users from Entra ID to IAS and then to cloud applications.

In the source system for Entra ID in IAS, we changed the default transformation code (user part):

Instead of:

 

 {
        "sourcePath": "$.userPrincipalName",
        "targetPath": "$.userName",
        "correlationAttribute": true
      },

we use:

{
  "sourcePath": "$.employeeId",
  "targetPath": "$.userName",
  "correlationAttribute": true
}

This way, the employee ID from Entra is provisioned to the Login Name field in IAS. When provisioning to the cloud application, a user is created with the employee ID as the user ID.

employeeId

Thank you very much for any tips

Best Regards

entry.title: SAP CIS ↔ SAP Ariba User Provisioning Issue (SCIM Schema mismatch)
entry.content:
Hello Community,

we are currently implementing user provisioning between SAP Cloud Identity Services (CIS) and SAP Ariba and followed the official SAP guide:
👉 SAP Ariba User Provisioning using SAP Identity Provisioning Service (IPS)

In this guide, it is recommended to create the following custom schema:

urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:vendor:ariba:2.0:User

We created this schema and successfully populated the attributes inside SAP CIS.
However, during provisioning from CIS to SAP Ariba, we noticed that the attributes are completely ignored and not recognized in Ariba.

The reason is a schema mismatch:

  • Schema delivered by CIS (wrong):

     
    urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:sap.ariba:2.0:User

  • Schema expected by Ariba SCIM API (correct):

     
    urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:sap:ariba:2.0:User

    The difference is small (sap.ariba vs. sap:ariba), but it prevents Ariba from accepting the attributes.
    As a result, although CIS contains the attributes, they never arrive in Ariba.

    Workaround we applied

    We manually built the correct Ariba schema in CIS, adjusted the user attributes, and extended the transformations accordingly. With this workaround, provisioning into Ariba now works as expected.

    Questions to the community

    1. Is this workaround acceptable as a long-term solution, or could it cause issues with future updates?

      We would greatly appreciate any insights or experiences with similar setups 🙏

      Best regards,
      Said
